meanings.definition: One who pours or serves drinks, especially in a tavern or bar.
meanings.sent1: The skinker at the pub was friendly and quick with the drinks.
meanings.sent2: The skinker behind the bar was busy serving customers all night.
meanings.sent3: The skinker accidentally spilled a drink on a customer, causing a funny commotion.
meanings.sent4: She was a skinker of joy, spreading happiness with every drink she served.
meanings.sent5: The skinker's skillful pouring made the drinks taste even better.

meanings.definition: To pour or serve drinks, especially in a tavern or bar.
meanings.sent1: He will skinker the drinks for the party tonight.
meanings.sent2: She skinkered the cocktails with precision and care.
meanings.sent3: The bartender skinkered the drinks so fast, it was like a magic show.
meanings.sent4: The rain skinkered down from the sky, refreshing the thirsty earth.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, she skinkered the last round of drinks for the evening crowd.
